intro: Lessertia ingeliensis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, velvety leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte or lithophyte, often found on trees or rocks in humid environments. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including white, pink, and purple, and bloom throughout the year in suitable conditions. The species is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
